vulnerability_location.description: Both withdrawal functions are public and lack any owner-only or authorization checks.
Unchecked low-level call using addr.call.value(0 wei)() without checking the returned success flag
External calls to token.transfer and owner.transfer can revert and block withdrawals, and an unbounded loop performing addr.call inside getTokens may run out of gas, causing a denial-of-service
Missing msg.data length check in function taking (uint num, address addr) allows a short address attack
Use of low-level call with addr.call.value(0) without checking the return value, leading to unsafe external calls
